ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS

block.text: HEBREWS

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 1
God has, in the past, spoken to the fathers through the prophets at many times and in various ways.

block.text: Allah qәdim zamanlarda dәfәlәrlә vә müxtәlif yollarla әcdadlarımıza peyğәmbәrlәr vasitәsilә müraciәt etmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He has at the end of these days spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the worlds.

block.text: Amma bu axır zamanda O bizә Oğul vasitәsilә müraciәt etdi; Onu hәr şeyin varisi tәyin etmişdi vә Onun vasitәsilә kainatı yaratmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His Son is the radiance of his glory, the very image of his substance, and upholding all things by the word of his power. When he had by himself purged our sins, he sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high.

block.text: Oğul Allahın izzәtinin әksi vә mahiyyәtinin tam surәtidir. O hәr şeyi qüdrәtli kәlamı ilә saxlayır. O, günahlardan tәmizlәnmәni tәmin edәndәn sonra ucalarda möhtәşәm Allahın sağında oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of God was made so much better than the angels, as he has inherited a more excellent name than they have.

block.text: Mәlәklәrdәn nә qәdәr üstün adı irs olaraq aldısa, o qәdәr onlardan üstün oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For to which of the angels did he say at any time,

block.text: Axı Allah mәlәklәrin hansına nә vaxtsa demişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are my Son. Today I have become your father.”

block.text: <<Sәn Mәnim Oğlumsan, Mәn bu gün Sәnә Ata oldum>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and again,

block.text: yaxud

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will be to him a Father, and he will be to me a Son.”

block.text: <<Mәn Ona Ata, O isә Mәnә Oğul olacaq>>?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, when he brings in the firstborn into the world he says,

block.text: Yenә dә Allah İlk Doğulanı dünyaya gәtirәndә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let all the angels of God worship him.”

block.text: <<Allahın bütün mәlәklәri qoy Onun qarşısında sәcdә etsin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Of the angels he says,

block.text: Mәlәklәr barәsindә isә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who makes his angels winds, and his servants a flame of fire.”

block.text: <<Öz mәlәklәrini külәklәrә, Öz xidmәtçilәrini yanar oda döndәrir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But of the Son he says,

block.text: Amma Oğul haqqında bunu deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your Kingdom.

block.text: <<Ey Allah, taxtın әbәdilik, sonsuzadәk qalır, Sәnin şahlıq әsan insaf әsasıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.”

block.text: Salehliyi sevib qanunsuzluğa nifrәt etmisәn. Ona görә Allah, Sәnin Allahın Sevinc yağı ilә Yoldaşlarından çox Sәni mәsh edib>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And,

block.text: Yenә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You, Lord, in the beginning, laid the foundation of the earth. The heavens are the works of your hands.

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, Sәn yerin tәmәlini әzәldәn qurmusan, Göylәr Sәnin әllәrinin işidir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will perish, but you continue. They all will grow old like a garment does.

block.text: Onlar yox olacaq, amma Sәn qalacaqsan, Hamısı paltar kimi köhnәlәcәk,

ReferenceBlocks.text: As a mantle, you will roll them up, and they will be changed; but you are the same. Your years will not fail.”

block.text: Onları geyim kimi bükәcәksәn, Onları paltar kimi dәyişdirәcәksәn. Amma Sәn dәyişmәzsәn, İllәrin tükәnmәzdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But which of the angels has he told at any time,

block.text: Lakin Allah mәlәklәrin hansına nә vaxtsa demişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet?”

block.text: <<Mәn düşmәnlәrini ayaqlarının altına kәtil kimi salanadәk Sağımda otur>>?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t they all serving spirits, sent out to do service for the sake of those who will inherit salvation?

block.text: Bütün mәlәklәr xilası irs olaraq alacaq şәxslәrә xidmәt etmәk üçün göndәrilәn xidmәtçi ruhlar deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 2
Therefore we ought to pay greater attention to the things that were heard, lest perhaps we drift away.

block.text: Buna görә dә biz eşitdiklәrimizә daha da diqqәtli olmalıyıq ki, axın bizi aparmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense;

block.text: Çünki mәlәklәr vasitәsilә bәyan edilәn söz qüvvәyә mindi, hәr cür tәqsir vә itaәtsizliyә haqlı cәza verildisә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: how will we escape if we neglect so great a salvation? Salvation which at the first, having been spoken through the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard;

block.text: bu cür böyük xilasa mәhәl qoymasaq, biz necә qurtula bilәrik? Bu xilas әvvәlcә Rәbb tәrәfindәn bildirildi vә Onu eşidәnlәr tәrәfindәn bizә tәsdiq olundu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God also testifying with them, both by signs and wonders, by various works of power, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to his own will?

block.text: Allah da әlamәt, xariqәlәr, müxtәlif möcüzәlәr vә Öz iradәsinә uyğun olaraq payladığı Müqәddәs Ruhun әnamları ilә şәhadәt etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he didn’t subject the world to come, of which we speak, to angels.

block.text: Barәsindә danışdığımız gәlәcәk dünyanı Allah mәlәklәrә tabe etmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But one has somewhere testified, saying,

block.text: Lakin kimsә bir yerdә belә şәhadәt etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is man, that you think of him? Or the son of man, that you care for him?

block.text: <<İnsan kimdir ki, onun haqqında düşünürsәn? Bәşәr oğlu kimdir ki, onun qayğısını çәkirsәn?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You made him a little lower than the angels. You crowned him with glory and honor; and did set him over the works of your hands.

block.text: Onu mәlәklәrdәn az müddәt әrzindә aşağı tutdun, İzzәt vә әzәmәt tacını onun başına qoydun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have put all things in subjection under his feet.”

block.text: Hәr şeyi onun ayağının altına qoyub tabe etdin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in that he subjected all things to him, he left nothing that is not subject to him. But now we don’t see all things subjected to him, yet.

block.text: Allah hәr şeyi insana tabe etdiyinә görә ona tabe olmamış heç nә qoymadı. Lakin indi biz hәr şeyin ona tabe olduğunu hәlә görmürük.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we see him who has been made a little lower than the angels, Jesus. Because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that by the grace of God he should taste of death for everyone.

block.text: Amma Allahın lütfü ilә hәr kәsin uğrunda ölmәk üçün mәlәklәrdәn az müddәt әrzindә aşağı tutulmuş Şәxsi, yәni İsanı görürük. Çәkdiyi ölüm әzabına görә Onun başına izzәt vә әzәmәt tacı qoyuldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it became him, for whom are all things, and through whom are all things, in bringing many children to glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

block.text: Hәr şey Allah üçün vә Allah vasitәsilә mövcuddur. Bir çox övladı izzәtә çatdırmaq üçün onların xilasının Banisini әzablar vasitәsilә kamil etmәsi Allaha münasib idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For both he who sanctifies and those who are sanctified are all from one, for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brothers,
saying,

block.text: Çünki tәqdis edәn Şәxsin vә tәqdis olunanların hamısının Atası eynidir. Bu sәbәbdәn İsa onları qardaş çağırmaqdan utanmayıb
deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will declare your name to my brothers. In the midst of the congregation I will sing your praise.”

block.text: <<İsmini qardaşlarıma elan edәcәyәm, Toplantı arasında Sәnә hәmd söylәyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again,

block.text: Yenә dә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will put my trust in him.”

block.text: <<Mәn Ona güvәnәcәyәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again,

block.text: vә yenә

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, here I am with the children whom God has given me.”

block.text: <<Budur, Mәn vә Allahın Mәnә verdiyi övladlar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since then the children have shared in flesh and blood, he also himself in the same way partook of the same, that through death he might bring to nothing him who had the power of death, that is, the devil.

block.text: Bu sәbәbdәn bu övladlar tәrkibcә qan vә әtdәn yarandıqlarına görә İsa Özü dә onların insan tәbiәtinә şәrik oldu ki, ölüm üzәrindә hakimiyyәt sahibi olanı, yәni iblisi Öz ölümü vasitәsilә tәsirsiz hala gәtirsin

ReferenceBlocks.text: People were like slaves all their lives because they were afraid of death. In dying, Jesus freed them.

block.text: vә ölüm qorxusuna görә ömürlәri boyu әsarәtdә olanların hamısını azad etsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly, he doesn’t give help to angels, but he gives help to the seed of Abraham.

block.text: Şübhәsiz, O, mәlәklәrә deyil, İbrahim nәslinә yardım edәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he was obligated in all things to be made like his brothers, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people.

block.text: Buna görә dә O hәr cәhәtdәn qardaşlarına bәnzәr olmalı idi; belә ki Allaha xidmәtindә mәrhәmәtli vә sadiq Baş Kahin olub xalqının günahları üçün kәffarә edә bilsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in that he himself has suffered being tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted.

block.text: Çünki Özü sınağa çәkilib әzab çәkdiyi üçün sınağa çәkilәnlәrә kömәk edә bilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 3
Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus.

block.text: Bu sәbәbә görә, ey sәmavi çağırışa ortaq olan müqәddәs qardaşlar, әqidәmizin Elçisi vә Baş Kahini İsa haqqında düşünün.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus was faithful to him who appointed him, as also was Moses in all his house.

block.text: İsa Onu tәyin edәn Kәsә sadiq qaldı; necә ki Musa da Allahın bütün evindә Ona sadiq qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who built the house has more honor than the house.

block.text: Evin bәnnası evdәn daha çox hörmәt qazandığı kimi İsa da Musadan daha böyük izzәtә layiq görüldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For every house is built by someone; but he who built all things is God.

block.text: Çünki hәr evin bir bәnnası var, hәr şeyin bәnnası isә Allahdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken.

block.text: Musa gәlәcәkdә deyilәcәk sözlәrә şәhadәt etmәk üçün Allahın bütün evindә bir xidmәtçi kimi sadiq qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Christ is faithful as a Son over his house; whose house we are, if we hold fast our confidence and the glorying of our hope firm to the end.

block.text: Amma Mәsih Onun evi üzәrindә Oğul olaraq sadiqdir. Әgәr biz cәsarәtimizi vә fәxr etdiyimiz ümidi qoruyub saxlasaq, Onun evi bizik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, even as the Holy Spirit says,

block.text: Buna görә Müqәddәs Ruhun dediyi kimi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today if you will hear his voice,
don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness.

block.text: <<Bu gün әgәr Onun sәsini eşitsәniz,
Qoy ürәklәriniz üsyan vaxtı olduğu kimi, Sәhradakı sınaq günündә olduğu kimi inadkar olmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Your fathers tested me by proving me, and saw my works for forty years.

block.text: Orada atalarınız Mәni sınadılar, Qırx il әmәllәrimi görәrәk Mәni yoxladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I was displeased with that generation, and said, ‘They always err in their heart, but they didn’t know my ways.’

block.text: Buna görә o nәsildәn zәhlәm getdi. Dedim: “Onlar hәmişә ürәklәrindә azır, Yollarımı tanımırlar”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I swore in my wrath, ‘They will not enter into my rest.’”

block.text: Buna görә qәzәblәnib and içmişәm: “Onlar Mәnim rahatlıq diyarıma girmәyәcәklәr”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware, brothers, lest perhaps there be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief, in falling away from the living God.

block.text: Ey qardaşlar, diqqәtli olun ki, sizlәrdәn heç birinizdә var olan Allahdan uzaqlaşan şәr vә imansız ürәk olmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called “today”; lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.

block.text: Amma <<bu gün>> adlanan hәr gün bir-birinizi ürәklәndirin ki, heç biriniz günahın aldadıcılığı ilә inadkar olmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm to the end:
while it is said,

block.text: Çünki әvvәldәn bizdә olan etimadı sonadәk möhkәm saxlasaq, Mәsihlә ortaq olarıq.
Necә ki deyilmişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.”

block.text: <<Bu gün әgәr Onun sәsini eşitsәniz, Qoy ürәklәriniz üsyan vaxtı olduğu kimi inadkar olmasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For who, when they heard, rebelled? No, didn’t all those who came out of Egypt by Moses?

block.text: Bәs eşidib üsyan edәnlәr kimdir? Musanın başçılığı ilә Misirdәn çıxanların hamısı deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: With whom was he displeased forty years? Wasn’t it with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?

block.text: Allah qırx il kimә qәzәblәnirdi? Günaha batmış, meyitlәri çöldә sәrilәnlәrә deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: To whom did he swear that they wouldn’t enter into his rest, but to those who were disobedient?

block.text: Bәs O kimlәrә and içdi ki, Onun rahatlıq diyarına girmәyәcәklәr? Mәgәr itaәt etmәyәnlәrә deyil?

ReferenceBlocks.text: We see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief.

block.text: Belәliklә, görürük ki, onlar imansızlığına görә oraya girә bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 4
Let us fear therefore, lest perhaps anyone of you should seem to have come short of a promise of entering into his rest.

block.text: Belәliklә, Allahın rahatlıq diyarına girmәk vәdi hәlә dә qüvvәdә olarkәn hәr birinizin bundan mәhrum olmasından qorxaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For indeed we have had good news preached to us, even as they also did, but the word they heard didn’t profit them, because it wasn’t mixed with faith by those who heard.

block.text: Çünki Misirdәn çıxanlar kimi biz dә Müjdә aldıq. Amma onların eşitdiyi kәlam onlara xeyir gәtirmәdi, çünki bu kәlama qulaq asanların imanına şәrik olmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we who have believed do enter into that rest, even as he has said,

block.text: Biz iman etmişlәrsә rahatlıq diyarına girmәkdәyik, necә ki Allah demişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As I swore in my wrath, they will not enter into my rest”

block.text: <<Buna görә qәzәblәnib and içmişәm: “Onlar Mәnim rahatlıq diyarıma girmәyәcәklәr”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

block.text: Halbuki Onun işlәri dünya yaranandan bәri tamamlanmışdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he has said this somewhere about the seventh day,

block.text: Çünki bir yerdә yeddinci gün barәsindә belә deyib:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “God rested on the seventh day from all his works”

block.text: <<Allah bütün gördüyü işlәrdәn ayrılıb yeddinci gün istirahәt etdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and in this place again,

block.text: Bu barәdә yenә deyib:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They will not enter into my rest.”

block.text: <<Onlar Mәnim rahatlıq diyarıma girmәyәcәklәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who received the good news first did not obey. So they do not enter God’s rest. Others may therefore still enter.

block.text: Belәliklә, bәzilәrinә o rahatlıq diyarına girmәk üçün, şübhәsiz ki, imkan qalır. Lakin Müjdәni әvvәlcәdәn eşidәnlәr itaәtsizliyә görә ora girә bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God again defines a certain day, today, saying through David so long a time afterward (just as has been said),

block.text: Bu sәbәbә görә Allah xeyli vaxt keçәndәn sonra Davud vasitәsilә <<bu gün>> deyәrәk tәkrar müәyyәn bir gün tәyin edir, necә ki әvvәlcә deyilmişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today if you will hear his voice, don’t harden your hearts.”

block.text: <<Bu gün әgәr Onun sәsini eşitsәniz, Qoy ürәklәriniz inadkar olmasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have spoken afterward of another day.

block.text: Çünki Yeşua onlara rahatlıq diyarı versәydi, Allah bundan sonra başqa bir gün barәsindә danışmazdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There remains therefore a Sabbath rest for the people of God.

block.text: Belәcә Allahın xalqı üçün hәlә dә bir istirahәt qalır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he who has entered into his rest has himself also rested from his works, as God did from his.

block.text: Allah Öz işlәrini qurtarıb Şәnbә günü istirahәt etdiyi kimi Onun rahatlıq diyarına girәn dә öz işlәrini qurtarıb istirahәt etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us therefore give diligence to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall after the same example of disobedience.

block.text: Buna görә dә bu rahatlıq diyarına girmәyә çalışaq ki, heç kәs eyni itaәtsizlik nümunәsinә әmәl edib yıxılmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the word of God is living, and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword. It pierces even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and is able to discern the thoughts and intentions of the heart.

block.text: Allahın kәlamı canlı vә tәsirlidir, hәr ikiağızlı qılıncdan da itidir, canla ruhu, oynaqlarla iliyi bir-birindәn ayıraraq keçir, ürәyin fikir vә niyyәtlәrini ayırd edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There is no creature that is hidden from his sight, but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

block.text: Allahdan gizli heç nә yoxdur. Lakin Onun gözlәri qarşısında hәr şey çılpaq vә açıq-aşkardır. Biz Ona hesabat verәcәyik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having then a great high priest, who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold tightly to our confession.

block.text: Belәliklә, Allahın Oğlu İsa göylәrdәn keçәn böyük Baş Kahinimiz olduğuna görә әqidәmizi möhkәm tutaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we don’t have a high priest who can’t be touched with the feeling of our infirmities. But one who has been in all points tempted like we are, yet without sin.

block.text: Çünki bizim Baş Kahinimiz belә deyil ki, zәifliklәrimizdә bizim halımıza acıya bilmәsin. Әksinә, hәr cәhәtdәn bizim kimi sınağa çәkilmiş, lakin günah etmәmişdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace. So that we may receive mercy, and may find grace for help in time of need.

block.text: Buna görә dә lütfkar Allahın taxtına cәsarәtlә yaxınlaşaq ki, vaxtında kömәyә nail olmaq üçün mәrhәmәt alıb lütf tapaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 5
For every high priest, being taken from among men, is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.

block.text: İnsanlar arasından seçilәn hәr baş kahin günahlardan ötrü tәqdim vә qurbanlar vermәk, Allahla bağlı olan işlәrdә insanları tәmsil etmәk üçün tәyin edilir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest can deal gently with those who are ignorant and going astray, because he himself is also surrounded with weakness.

block.text: Cahillәrlә vә yolunu azmışlarla hәlim davrana bilir, çünki özü dә zәifliyә mәruzdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because of this, he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people, as well as for himself.

block.text: Buna görә o, xalqın günahları üçün olduğu kimi öz günahları üçün dә qurbanlar tәqdim etmәlidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nobody takes this honor on himself, but he is called by God, just like Aaron was.

block.text: Heç kәs bu şәrәfә öz-özünә nail olmur, ancaq Harun kimi Allah tәrәfindәn çağırılanda nail olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So also Christ didn’t glorify himself to be made a high priest, but it was he who said to him,

block.text: Elәcә dә Mәsih dә Baş Kahin olmaq üçün Öz-Özünü izzәtlәndirmәdi, Ona deyәn Allah Onu izzәtlәndirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are my Son. Today I have become your father.”

block.text: <<Sәn Mәnim oğlumsan, Mәn bu gün Sәnә Ata oldum>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he says also in another place,

block.text: Digәr yerdә isә O belә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are a priest forever, after the order of Melchizedek.”

block.text: <<Sәn Melkisedeq vәzifәli әbәdi bir Kahinsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, in the days of his flesh, offered up prayers and petitions with strong crying and tears. He prayed to him who was able to save him from death, and God heard him because Christ honored God.

block.text: Mәsih yer üzündә cisimdә olduğu günlәrdә Onu ölümdәn qurtarmağa qadir olan Allaha böyük fәryad vә göz yaşları ilә dua edib yalvardı vә möminliyinә görә eşidildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Though he was God’s Son, yet he learned obedience by the things which he suffered.

block.text: O, Oğul olduğu halda çәkdiyi әzablarla itaәtli olmağı öyrәndi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having been made perfect, he became to all of those who obey him the author of eternal salvation,

block.text: Kamilliyә çatandan sonra Ona itaәt edәnlәrin hamısı üçün әbәdi xilas qaynağı oldu

ReferenceBlocks.text: named by God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek.

block.text: vә Allah tәrәfindәn Melkisedeq vәzifәli Baş Kahin tәyin edildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About him we have many words to say, and hard to interpret, seeing you have become dull of hearing.

block.text: Bu mövzuda deyilәsi sözümüz çoxdur, amma bunları izah etmәk çәtindir. Çünki sizin qulağınız ağır eşidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For although by this time you should be teachers, you again need to have someone teach you the rudiments of the first principles of the oracles of God. You have come to need milk, and not solid food.

block.text: Siz artıq müәllim olmalı idiniz; amma kimsәnin sizә tәkrarәn Allahın kәlamının ibtidai tәlimlәrini öyrәtmәsinә hәlә dә möhtacsınız. Siz bәrk yemәyә yox, südә möhtac olmusunuz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who lives on milk is not experienced in the word of righteousness, for he is a baby.

block.text: Südlә bәslәnәn hәr kәs körpә olduğu üçün salehlik barәsindә olan kәlamda tәcrübәsizdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But solid food is for those who are full grown, who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil.

block.text: Bәrk yemәk isә yetkinlәr, yәni duyğularını xeyirlә şәri ayırd etmәkdәn ötrü hәssas edәnlәr üçündür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 6
Therefore leaving the teaching of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfection-- Let us not lay again the foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,

block.text: Bunun üçün Mәsih barәsindәki ibtidai tәlimi geridә buraxıb kamilliyә doğru irәlilәyәk. Ölüm gәtirәn әmәllәrdәn tövbә edib Allaha iman etmәnin tәmәlini,

ReferenceBlocks.text: of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

block.text: vәftizlәr, әl qoyub tәqdis etmә, ölülәrin dirilmәsi vә әbәdi mәhkәmә haqqındakı tәlimin әsasını yenidәn qurmayaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This will we do, if God permits.

block.text: Allah izin verәrsә, bunlara da әmәl edәcәyik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Consider the case of those who have fallen back into their former lives: they were illuminated by the light of God. They tasted the gift from heaven and they received the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Bir dәfә nurlanmış, sәmavi әnamdan dadmış vә Müqәddәs Ruha şәrik olmuş,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They loved the beautiful word of God, they felt the powerful forces of the world to come.

block.text: Allahın xoş kәlamını vә gәlәcәk dövrün qüvvәlәrini dadmış olduqları halda

ReferenceBlocks.text: And yet they have fallen back into their old life. It is impossible for these people to be brought back to repentance. They have nailed the Son of God on the cross again, and have subjected him to public disgrace.

block.text: imandan dönәnlәri yenidәn tövbә edәcәk vәziyyәtinә gәtirmәk mümkün deyil. Çünki özlәri Allahın Oğlunu yenidәn çarmıxa çәkib rüsvay edirlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it, and brings forth a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receives blessing from God.

block.text: Dәfәlәrlә üstünә yağan yağışı içәn vә kimlәr üçün işlәnirsә, onlara faydalı bitkilәr yetişdirәn torpaq Allahdan xeyir-bәrәkәt alır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if it bears thorns and thistles, it is rejected and in danger of being cursed. In the end, it will be burned.

block.text: Tikan vә qanqal yetişdirәn torpaq isә yararsız vә lәnәtә yaxındır, onun sonu yanmaqdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things for you, and things that accompany salvation, even though we speak like this.

block.text: Lakin, ey sevimlilәr, biz bu cür danışsaq belә, әminik ki, vәziyyәtiniz daha yaxşıdır vә xilasa malik olursunuz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For God is not unrighteous, so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you showed toward his name. You served the saints, and still do serve them.

block.text: Axı Allah әdalәtsiz deyil ki, әmәlinizi vә Onun adı ilә müqәddәslәrә әvvәldәn vә indi dә xidmәt etmәklә göstәrdiyiniz mәhәbbәti unutsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We desire that each one of you may show the same diligence to the fullness of hope even to the end.

block.text: Ümidin verdiyi tam etimada nail olmaq üçün axıra qәdәr hәr birinizin eyni sәyi göstәrmәyinizi arzulayırıq ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: We do not want you to be sluggish, but rather, imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises.

block.text: siz tәnbәl olmayasınız, amma vәd olunan şeylәri iman vә sәbirlә irs alanlardan nümunә götürәsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he swore by himself,
saying,

block.text: Allah İbrahimә vәd verdiyi vaxt adına and içmәk üçün Özündәn üstün birinin olmadığına görә Öz varlığına and içәrәk
dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Surely I will bless you and I will multiply you.”

block.text: <<Sәnә mütlәq xeyir-dua verәcәyәm vә nәslini çoxaldacağam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

block.text: Belәliklә, İbrahim sәbirlә gözlәyәrәk vәdә nail oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For men indeed swear by a greater one, and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation.

block.text: İnsanlar özlәrindәn daha üstün olanın adına and içirlәr vә sözlәrini tәsdiq edәn and hәr iddiaya son qoyur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In this way God, being determined to show more abundantly to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel, interposed with an oath;

block.text: Elәcә dә Allah vәdin varislәrinә iradәsinin dәyişmәzliyini daha açıq-aşkar etmәk istәyәrәk öz vәdini andla tәsdiqlәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement. We have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us.

block.text: Belә ki qarşımıza qoyulan ümidә bağlanmaq üçün Allaha sığınan bizlәr Allahın bunlarda yalan danışması qeyri-mümkün olduğuna görә iki dәyişilmәz şeydә – Onun vәd vә andında böyük tәsәlliyә malik olaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and steadfast and entering into that which is within the veil.

block.text: Can lövbәrimiz kimi möhkәm vә sarsılmaz olan bu ümid mәbәdin pәrdәsinin arxasındakı iç otağa daxil olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus has already entered for us, having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.

block.text: İsa ilk olaraq bizim uğrumuzda oraya daxil oldu; O, Melkisedeq vәzifәli әbәdi Baş Kahin olmuşdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 7
For this Melchizedek was king of Salem, priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him.

block.text: Bu Melkisedeq Salem padşahı vә Allah-Taalanın kahini idi. Padşahları mәğlub edib geri qayıdan İbrahimin pişvazına çıxdı vә ona xeyir-dua verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Abraham divided and gave to Melchizedek a tenth part of all (being first, by interpretation, king of righteousness, and then also king of Salem, which is king of peace.

block.text: İbrahim dә ona hәr şeyin onda bir hissәsini verdi. Melkisedeq әn әvvәl öz adının mәnasına görә salehlik padşahıdır, sonra isә Salem padşahı, yәni sülh padşahıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Melchizedek was without father, without mother, and without a genealogy. He has neither beginning of days nor end of life. Like the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.

block.text: O, atasız, anasız olub nәsil şәcәrәsi yoxdur. Nә günlәrinin başlanğıcı, nә dә hәyatının sonu var. Lakin Allahın Oğluna bәnzәdilmiş әbәdi kahin olaraq qalır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now consider how great this man was, to whom even Abraham, the patriarch, gave a tenth out of the best spoils.

block.text: Baxın bu adam necә böyükdür ki, ulu babamız İbrahim belә qәnimәtlәrinin onda bir hissәsini ona verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest’s office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law. That is, of their brothers, though these have come out of the body of Abraham.

block.text: Levi oğullarından kahinlik vәzifәsini alanlar, Qanuna görә xalqdan, yәni İbrahim nәslindәn olduqları halda, öz qardaşlarından onda bir hissәni almaq әmrinә malikdirlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Melchizedek, whose genealogy is not counted from them, has accepted tithes from Abraham and has blessed him who has the promises.

block.text: Amma onların nәslindәn olmayan Melkisedeq İbrahimdәn onda bir hissәni aldı vә vәdlәrә malik olana xeyir-dua verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But without any dispute the lesser is blessed by the greater.

block.text: Şübhәsiz ki, böyük özündәn kiçiyә xeyir-dua verәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here people who die receive tithes, but there one receives tithes of whom it is testified that he lives.

block.text: Burada onda bir hissәni ölümlü insanlar alır, orada isә yaşadığına dair şәhadәtә malik olan bir nәfәr alır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We can say that through Abraham even Levi, who receives tithes, has paid tithes.

block.text: Demәk olar ki, onda bir hissәni alan Levi dә İbrahim vasitәsilә onda bir hissәni vermişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We can say this because he was yet in the body of his father when Melchizedek met him.

block.text: Çünki Melkisedeq İbrahimin pişvazına çıxanda Levi hәlә әcdadının belindә idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now if there were perfection through the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people have received the law), what further need was there for another priest to arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be called after the order of Aaron?

block.text: Belәliklә, әgәr kamillik Levililәrin kahinliyi vasitәsilә әldә edilsәydi – çünki xalq bu kahinliyә әsasәn Qanunu alıb – Harun vәzifәli deyil, Melkisedeq vәzifәli başqa bir kahinin tәyin edilmәsi barәdә danışmağa daha nә ehtiyac vardı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the priesthood being changed, there is of necessity a change made also in the law.

block.text: Çünki kahinlik dәyişilәndә Qanunun da dәyişilmәsinә ehtiyac var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he of whom these things are said belongs to another tribe, from which no one has officiated at the altar.

block.text: Haqqında bu sözlәr deyilәn Adam başqa bir qәbilәyә mәnsubdur vә bu qәbilәdәn heç kәs qurbangahda xidmәt etmәmişdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is evident that our Lord has sprung out of Judah, about which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood.

block.text: Axı Rәbbimizin Yәhuda qәbilәsindәn törәmәsi mәlumdur. Musa bu qәbilә barәsindә kahinlәrә aid bir söz demәmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here is why things are even clearer: another priest came, and he looks like Melchizedek.

block.text: Melkisedeqә bәnzәr başqa bir Kahinin tәyin edilmәsi bunu daha da aydın göstәrir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is not a priest according to a rule and according to human commandments. He became a priest by the power of a life that can not end.

block.text: O, Qanunun cismani kahinlik әmrinә görә deyil, tükәnmәz hәyat qüdrәtinә görә Kahin oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is true, the Holy Scriptures say:

block.text: Çünki deyә şәhadәt olunur:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.”

block.text: <<Sәn Melkisedeq vәzifәli әbәdi bir Kahinsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God put aside the previous law of Moses because it was weak and useless.

block.text: Bundan әvvәlki әmr zәif vә yararsız olduğuna görә lәğv olunur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For the law made nothing perfect), and a bringing in of a better hope, through which we draw near to God.

block.text: Çünki Qanun heç bir şeyi kamillәşdirmәyib. Bunun yerinә bizi Allaha yaxınlaşdıran daha gözәl ümid verilir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Inasmuch as he was not made priest without the taking of an oath.

block.text: Bu kahinlik isә andsız olmadı. O biri kahinlәr andsız kahin oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (They indeed have been made priests without an oath), but he with an oath by him that says of him,

block.text: Lakin İsa Ona deyәn Allah vasitәsilә andla kahin oldu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord swore and will not change his mind, ‘You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.’”

block.text: <<Rәbb and içdi, qәrarını dәyişmәz: “Sәn әbәdi bir Kahinsәn”>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: By so much, Jesus has become the collateral of a better covenant.

block.text: Buna görә İsa daha yaxşı Әhdin zәmanәtçisi oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many, indeed, have been made priests, because they are hindered from continuing by death.

block.text: Bununla belә, hәmin kahinlәrin sayı çox idi, çünki ölüm onların vәzifәdә qalmasına mane olurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, because he lives forever, has his priesthood unchangeable.

block.text: Lakin İsa әbәdi yaşadığı üçün daimi kahinliyә malikdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he is also able to save to the uttermost those who draw near to God through him, seeing that he lives forever to make intercession for them.

block.text: Buna görә O Özü vasitәsilә Allaha yaxınlaşanları tam xilas etmәyә qadirdir. Çünki O onlar üçün vәsatәtçilik etmәkdәn ötrü hәmişә yaşayır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For such a high priest was fitting for us: holy, guiltless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;

block.text: Hәqiqәtәn, bizә belә bir Baş Kahinin olması münasibdir ki, O, müqәddәs, günahsız, lәkәsiz, günahkarlardan ayrılmış, göylәrdәn daha ucalara qaldırılmış olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: who doesn’t need, like those high priests, to offer up sacrifices daily, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. For he did this once for all, when he offered up himself.

block.text: O başqa baş kahinlәr kimi әvvәlcә öz günahları, sonra da xalqın günahları üçün hәr gün qurban tәqdim etmәk mәcburiyyәtindә deyil. Çünki Özünü qurban vermәklә bunu birdәfәlik etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness, but the word of the oath which came after the law appoints a Son forever who has been perfected.

block.text: Qanun zәifliklәri olan insanları baş kahin tәyin edir. Lakin Qanundan sonra verilmiş and sözü әbәdi olaraq kamillәşdirilmiş Oğulu tәyin etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 8
Now in the things which we are saying, the main point is this. We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens.

block.text: Deyilәnlәrin әsası isә budur: bizim elә bir Baş Kahinimiz var ki, göylәrdәki möhtәşәm Allahın taxtının sağında oturub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is a servant of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, not man.

block.text: O, Müqәddәs mәkanda vә insanın deyil, Rәbbin qurduğu hәqiqi çadırda xidmәt edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this high priest also have something to offer.

block.text: Hәr baş kahin tәqdim vә qurban gәtirmәk üçün tәyin olunur. Buna görә bizim dә Baş Kahinimizin tәqdim etmәk üçün nәyisә olmalıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if he were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, seeing there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law.

block.text: Әgәr Özü yer üzündә olsaydı, әsla Kahin olmazdı. Çünki Qanuna әsasәn tәqdim gәtirәnlәr var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to make the tabernacle, for he said,

block.text: Onlar göylәrdәkilәrin tәsviri vә kölgәsi olan yerdә ibadәt edir, necә ki Musa İbadәt çadırını qurmaq üzrә olanda Allah onu xәbәrdar etmişdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See, you shall make everything according to the pattern that was shown to you on the mountain.”

block.text: <<Dağda sәnә göstәrilәn nümunәyә görә bunların hamısını ehtiyatla düzәlt>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now he has obtained a more excellent ministry, by so much as he is also the mediator of a better covenant. A better covenant which on better promises has been given as law.

block.text: Amma indi İsa daha yaxşı vәdlәr üzәrindә qurulmuş daha yaxşı bir Әhdin Vasitәçisi olduğu qәdәr üstün bir xidmәtә nail oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then no place would have been sought for a second.

block.text: Әgәr ilk Әhd qüsursuz olsaydı, ikinci Әhdә sәbәb axtarılmazdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For finding fault with them, he said,

block.text: Çünki Allah Öz xalqını tәqsirkar çıxararaq deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the days come,” says the Lord, “that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.

block.text: <<Rәbb bәyan edir: “İsrail xalqı vә Yәhuda xalqı ilә Yeni bir Әhd bağlayacağım günlәr yaxınlaşır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will not be according to the covenant that I made with their fathers, in the day that I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; for they didn’t continue in my covenant, and I disregarded them,” says the Lord.

block.text: Bu Әhd Atalarını Misir torpağından çıxartmaq üçün Әllәrindәn tutduğum gün Onlarla bağladığım әhdә bәnzәmәyәcәk. Çünki onlar әhdimә sadiq qalmadılar, Mәn dә onlardan üz döndәrdim” Rәbb belә bәyan edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel. After those days,” says the Lord;

block.text: “O günlәrdәn sonra İsrail xalqı ilә Bağlayacağım Әhd belәdir” Rәbb bәyan edir,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will put my laws into their mind, I will also write them on their heart. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

block.text: “Qanunlarımı onların zehinlәrinә qoyub Ürәklәrinә yazacağam. Mәn onların Allahı, Onlar da Mәnim xalqım olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will not teach every man his fellow citizen, and every man his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord.’ All will know me, from their least to their greatest.

block.text: Bir kәs öz hәmvәtәnini yaxud qardaşını ‹Rәbbi tanı› deyib öyrәtmәyәcәk. Çünki böyükdәn kiçiyә qәdәr hamı Mәni tanıyacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness. I will remember their sins and lawless deeds no more.”

block.text: Çünki tәqsirlәrinә qarşı mәrhәmәtli olacağam, Günahlarını daha yada salmayacağam”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that he says, “A new covenant,” he has made the first old. But that which is becoming old and grows aged is near to vanishing away.

block.text: Allah <<Yeni Әhd>> demәklә birincisinin köhnә olduğunu göstәrir. Köhnәlәn vә yaşa dolansa çox keçmәdәn yox olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 9
Now indeed even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service, and an earthly sanctuary.

block.text: Birinci Әhdin dә ibadәt barәsindәki qaydaları vә dünyәvi Müqәddәs mәkanı var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a tabernacle was prepared. In the first part were the lampstand, the table, and the show bread; which is called the Holy Place.

block.text: Bir çadır qurulmuşdu. Müqәddәs yer adlanan ilk bölmәdә çıraqdan, masa vә tәqdis çörәklәri var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the second veil was the tabernacle which is called the Holy of Holies.

block.text: İkinci pәrdә arxasında isә Әn Müqәddәs yer adlanan bir bölmә var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the Holy of Holies was a golden altar of incense, and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold. In this ark was a golden pot holding the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant.

block.text: Burada qızıl buxur qurbangahı ilә hәr tәrәfdәn qızılla örtülmüş Әhd sandığı var idi. Sandığın içindә manna ilә dolu qızıl qab, Harunun tumurcuqlamış әsası vә Әhd lövhәlәri var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Above the ark were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat, but we cannot discuss these things in detail now.

block.text: Sandığın üzәrindә isә kәffarә qapağına kölgә salan izzәtli keruvlar var idi. Lakin bunlar barәsindә indi әtraflı danışa bilmirik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now these things having been thus prepared, the priests go in continually into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the services.

block.text: Bu şeylәr belә qurulduqdan sonra kahinlәr hәmişә çadırın ilk bölmәsinә daxil olub ibadәti aparırlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But into the second, the high priest enters alone, once a year, and never without blood which he offers for himself, and for the sins of the people.

block.text: İkinci bölmәsinә isә yalnız baş kahin daxil ola bilәr. O da özü üçün vә xalqın bilmәdәn işlәtdiyi günahlar üçün orada tәqdim etdiyi qurban qanı olmadan o yerә daxil ola bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Holy Spirit is indicating this, that the way into the Holy Place wasn’t yet revealed while the first tabernacle was still standing.

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruh bununla göstәrir ki, çadırın ilk bölmәsi durduqca Әn Müqәddәs yerә gedәn yol hәlә aşkar olmamışdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is a symbol of the present age. Where gifts and sacrifices are offered that are incapable, concerning the conscience, of making the worshipper perfect.

block.text: Bu çadır indiki vaxt üçün bir misaldır. Bu sәbәbdәn ibadәt edәnin vicdanını kamillәşdirә bilmәyәn tәqdimlәr vә qurbanlar verilir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are only (with meats and drinks and various washings) fleshly ordinances, imposed until a time of reformation.

block.text: Bunlar ancaq yemәk, içmәk vә cürbәcür yuyunma tәrzlәri ilә, yәni hәr şeyin nizama salınacağı vaxtadәk qüvvәdә olub cismani işlәrә mәxsus olan qaydalarla әlaqәdardır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Christ came as a high priest of the good things God promised. He made the way for man to go to God. He was a greater and more perfect tent (Tabernacle). He was not made by human hands and he was not a part of this earth.

block.text: Lakin Mәsih indi gәlәn nemәtlәrin Baş Kahini olaraq gәldi. İnsan әli ilә qurulmamış, yәni bu yaradılışdan olmayan daha böyük vә daha mükәmmәl çadırdan keçib

ReferenceBlocks.text: Christ went into the Most Holy Place one time for all people. He did not take the blood of goats and young cows to give to God as a gift in worship. He gave his own blood. Thus he bought us with his own blood and made us free from sin forever.

block.text: tәkәlәrlә danaların qanı ilә yox, Öz qanı ilә Әn Müqәddәs yerә birdәfәlik daxil oldu; әbәdi satınalınmanı tәmin etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blood of goats and bulls, and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling those who have been defiled, sanctify them so they are outwardly clean.

block.text: Çünki әgәr tәkәlәrlә buğaların qanı vә düyәnin külünün murdar olanların üstünә sәpilmәsi onları tәqdis edib cismәn tәmizlәyirsә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: How much more then will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

block.text: demәli, әbәdi Ruh vasitәsilә Özünü qüsursuz olaraq Allaha tәqdim etmiş Mәsihin qanı var olan Allaha ibadәt edә bilmәmiz üçün vicdanımızı ölüm gәtirәn әmәllәrdәn nә qәdәr çox tәmizlәyәcәk!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this reason he is the mediator of a new covenant, since a death has occurred for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first covenant. That those who have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.

block.text: Buna görә dә çağırılmışların vәd edilәn әbәdi irsi alması üçün Mәsih Yeni Әhdin Vasitәçisidir. Çünki O, Birinci Әhd zamanı etdiklәri tәqsirlәrdәn onları satın almaq üçün ölmüşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where a last will and testament is, there must of necessity be the death of him who made it.

block.text: Bir vәsiyyәtnamә varsa, vәsiyyәt edәnin ölümünü sübut etmәk lazımdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a will is in force where there has been death, for it is never in force while he who made it lives.

block.text: Çünki vәsiyyәtnamә ancaq ölümdәn sonra qüvvәyә minir. Vәsiyyәt edәn sağ olanda vәsiyyәtnamәnin heç bir qüvvәsi yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore even the first covenant has not been dedicated without blood.

block.text: Bu sәbәbә görә Birinci Әhd dә qan axıdılmadan qüvvәyә minmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of the calves and the goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people,
saying,

block.text: Musa Qanunun hәr әmrini bütün xalqın önündә bәyan edәndәn sonra su, al rәngli yun vә züfa otu ilә dana vә tәkәlәrin qanını götürüb hәm kitabın özünә, hәm dә bütün xalqın üzәrinә sәpәrәk
dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the blood of the covenant which God has commanded you.”

block.text: <<Budur Allahın sizә әmr etdiyi Әhdin qanı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover he sprinkled the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry in the same way with the blood.

block.text: Eyni tәrzdә çadır vә bütün xidmәt әşyalarının üzәrinә qan sәpdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: According to the law, nearly everything is cleansed with blood, and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission.

block.text: Demәk olar ki, Qanuna görә hәr bir şey qanla tәmizlәnir vә qan axıdılmadan bağışlanma olmur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

block.text: Belәliklә, göylәrdәkilәrin tәsvirlәrini bu qurbanlarla, göylәrdәkilәri isә bunlardan daha yaxşı qurbanlarla tәmizlәmәk lazım idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Christ hasn’t entered into holy places made with hands, which are representations of the true, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us.

block.text: Mәsih әsl Müqәddәs mәkanın nümunәsi olub insan әli ilә qurulan Müqәddәs mәkana deyil, göyün özünә daxil oldu ki, indi bizim üçün Allahın hüzurunda zahir olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nor did he enter heaven to offer himself again and again, as the high priest enters into the holy place year by year with blood not his own.

block.text: Baş kahin hәr il özünün olmayan qanla Әn Müqәddәs yerә girәr. Amma Mәsih Özünü dәfәlәrlә tәqdim etmәk üçün göyә girmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Christ would have had to suffer many times since the foundation of the world. But now once at the end of the ages, he has been revealed to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.

block.text: Elә olsaydı, O, dünya yaranandan bәri dәfәlәrlә әzab çәkmәli olardı. İndi isә dövrlәrin sonunda, O Özünü qurban vermәklә günahı aradan qaldırmaq üçün bir dәfә zühur etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is appointed for all men to die once, and after this, judgment.

block.text: Necә müәyyәn edilmişdir ki, insanlar bir dәfә ölüb ondan sonra mühakimә olunsunlar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is the same with Christ also. He was offered once to bear the sins of many. He will come a second time, without sin, to those who are eagerly waiting for him for salvation.

block.text: elәcә dә Mәsih bir çoxlarının günahını Öz üzәrinә götürmәk üçün bir dәfә tәqdim edilmişdir vә ikinci dәfә günahın öhdәsindәn gәlmәk üçün deyil, xilas gәtirmәk üçün Onu gözlәyәnlәrә zühur edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 10
For the law, having a shadow of the good to come, not the very image of the things, can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect those who draw near.

block.text: Qanunda gәlәcәk nemәtlәrin әsli deyil, kölgәsi vardır. Buna görә dә Qanun ildәn-ilә daimi bir surәtdә tәqdim olunan eyni qurbanlar vasitәsilә Allaha yaxınlaşanları әsla kamil edә bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or else wouldn’t they have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins?

block.text: Әks tәqdirdә, bu qurbanların tәqdim olunmasına son qoyulardı. Çünki ibadәt edәnlәr birdәfәlik tәmizlәnәndәn sonra artıq günahlarına görә vicdan әzabı çәkmәzdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But in those sacrifices there is a yearly reminder of sins.

block.text: Amma bu qurbanlar vasitәsilә insanlar ildәn-ilә günahlarını yadlarına salır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.

block.text: Çünki buğaların vә tәkәlәrin qanı ilә günahları aradan qaldırmaq qeyri-mümkündür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when he comes into the world, he says,

block.text: Buna görә Mәsih dünyaya gәlәndә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sacrifice and offering you didn’t desire, but you prepared a body for me;

block.text: <<Qurban vә tәqdim istәmәdin, Amma Mәnә bir bәdәn hazırladın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You had no pleasure in whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin.

block.text: Yandırma qurbanı, günah qurbanından xoşun gәlmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come (in the scroll of the book it is written of me) to do your will, O God.’”

block.text: O zaman dedim: “Budur, gәlmişәm, Kitab tumarında Mәnim haqqımda yazılıb. Ay Allah, Sәnin iradәni yerinә yetirim”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Previously saying,

block.text: Mәsih әvvәl dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn’t desire, neither had pleasure in them”

block.text: <<Qurban, tәqdim, yandırma qurbanı vә günah qurbanı istәmәdin, Bunlardan xoşun gәlmәdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (although the law required them to be made),
then he has said,

block.text: Bunlar hamısı Qanuna görә tәqdim olunur.
Sonra dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I have come to do your will.”

block.text: <<Budur, gәlmişәm, Sәnin iradәni yerinә yetirim>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He takes away the first, that he may establish the second.

block.text: Yәni, Mәsih ikinci Әhdi qüvvәyә mindirmәk üçün birincisini lәğv edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By that sacrifice, we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

block.text: Bu iradәyә әsasәn biz İsa Mәsihin bәdәninin birdәfәlik tәqdim olunmasına görә tәqdis olunduq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every priest indeed stands day by day serving and often offering the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.

block.text: Hәr bir kahin hәr gün xidmәtini icra edәrәk әsla günahları aradan qaldıra bilmәyәn eyni qurbanları dәfәlәrlә tәqdim edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down on the right hand of God.

block.text: Amma Mәsih günahlar üçün yalnız bir qurban tәqdim edәndәn sonra әbәdi olaraq Allahın sağında oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since that time he waits until his enemies are made the footstool of his feet.

block.text: O vaxtdan bәri O, düşmәnlәrinin Onun ayaqları altına kәtil kimi salınmasını gözlәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are being sanctified.

block.text: Çünki O yalnız bir tәqdim vasitәsilә tәqdis olunmaqda olanları hәmişәlik kamillәşdirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying,

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruh da bu haqda bizә şәhadәt edir. Çünki әvvәl deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is the covenant that I will make with them:

block.text: <<“O günlәrdәn sonra Onlarla bağlayacağım Әhd belәdir” Rәbb bәyan edir,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘After those days,’ says the Lord, ‘I will put my laws on their heart, I will also write them on their mind;’”

block.text: “Qanunlarımı onların ürәyinә qoyub Zehinlәrinә yazacağam”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: then he says,

block.text: Sonra deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will remember their sins and their iniquities no more.”

block.text: <<Günahlarını vә qanunsuzluqlarını yada salmayacağam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.

block.text: Günahların bağışlanması olanda isә artıq günah üçün tәqdim etmә yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having therefore, brothers, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus.

block.text: Belәliklә, ey qardaşlar, İsanın qanı sayәsindә Әn Müqәddәs yerә daxil olmağa cәsarәtimiz çatır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We now come to God by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh.

block.text: O bizә pәrdәdәn, yәni Öz cismindәn keçәn yeni vә canlı bir yol açmışdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have a great priest over God’s house.

block.text: Hәm dә O, Allahın evi üçün cavabdeh olan böyük bir Kahinimizdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, let’s draw near with a true heart in fullness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and having our body washed with pure water.

block.text: Ona görә ürәklәrimiz pis vicdandan paklanmış, bәdәnlәrimiz dә tәmiz su ilә yuyulmuş halda imanın tam etimadı ilә, sәmimi qәlblә Allaha yaxınlaşaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for he who promised is faithful.

block.text: Ümid verәn әqidәdәn möhkәm tutaq, çünki vәd verәn Allah sadiqdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,

block.text: Bir-birimizi mәhәbbәtә vә xeyirxah әmәllәr etmәk üçün necә hәvәslәndirmәk haqqında fikirlәşәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as you see the Day approaching.

block.text: Bәzi adamların vәrdiş etdiyi kimi birgә yığışmağımızı tәrk etmәyәk. Lakin qiyamәt gününün yaxınlaşdığını gördükcә bir-birimizi daha çox ruhlandıraq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remains no more a sacrifice for sins.

block.text: Hәqiqәti dәrk edib qәbul edәndәn sonra qәsdәn günah etmәkdә davam etsәk, artıq günah üçün qurban qalmır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Instead their will be a certain fearful expectation of judgment and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries.

block.text: Lakin mühakimәnin vә Allahın düşmәnlәrini yandırıb-yaxan şiddәtli alovun dәhşәtlә gözlәnmәsi qalır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A man who disregards Moses’ law dies without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses.

block.text: Musanın Qanununu heç sayan adam iki yaxud üç şahidin sözü ilә rәhm edilmәdәn öldürülür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How much worse punishment, do you think, will he be judged worthy of, who has trodden under foot the Son of God? And who has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?

block.text: Әgәr bir nәfәr Allahın Oğlunu tapdalayaraq tәqdis edildiyi Әhdin qanını adi bir şey sayıb Allahın lütfkar Ruhunu tәhqir edәrsә, sizcә bundan nә qәdәr ağır cәzaya layiq sayılacaq?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we know him who said,

block.text: Çünki deyәni tanıyırıq:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Vengeance belongs to me,” says the Lord, “I will repay.”

block.text: <<Qisas Mәnimdir, әvәzini Mәn verәcәyәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again,

block.text: vә yenә dә

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord will judge his people.”

block.text: <<Rәbb Öz xalqını mühakimә edәcәk>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

block.text: Var olan Allahın әlinә düşmәk dәhşәtdir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: But remember the former days, in which, after you were enlightened, you endured a great struggle with sufferings.

block.text: Siz әvvәlki günlәri xatırlayın. O vaxt Allahın nuru üzәrinizә saçandan sonra әzablı, böyük mübarizәyә tab gәtirdiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: People laughed at you and beat you. When others suffered, you suffered with them.

block.text: Bәzәn tәhqir vә әziyyәtlәrә uğrayıb tamaşaya qoyuldunuz, bәzәnsә eyni rәftara mәruz qalanların dәrdinә şәrik oldunuz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you both had compassion on me in my chains. You joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in heaven.

block.text: Hәm dә siz mәhbusların çәkdiyi әzablara şәrik oldunuz, özünüzün daha yaxşı vә daimi malınız olduğunu bilәrәk әmlakınızın talan edilmәsini sevinclә qәbul etdiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t throw away your boldness, which has a great reward.

block.text: Buna görә cәsarәtinizi itirmәyin, bu cәsarәtә görә mükafatınız böyükdür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.
Because,

block.text: Çünki Allahın iradәsini yerinә yetirib vәd olunan şeyi almaq üçün sizin tab gәtirmәyә ehtiyacınız var.
Çünki

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In a very little while, he who comes will come, and will not wait.

block.text: <<Bir az müddәtdәn sonra Gәlәn gәlәcәk, gecikmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the righteous will live by faith. If he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.”

block.text: Amma saleh adamım imanla yaşayacaq. Әgәr geri çәkilsә, ondan razı qalmayacağam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.

block.text: Bizsә geri çәkilib hәlak olanlardan deyilik; iman edib canlarının xilasına nail olanlardanıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 11
Now faith is assurance of things hoped for, proof of things not seen.

block.text: İman ümid edilәnlәrә etibar etmәk, görünmәyәn şeylәrә әmin olmaqdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by this, the elders obtained testimony.

block.text: Әcdadlarımız imanları üçün müsbәt şәhadәt aldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, we understand that the universe has been framed by the word of God, so that what is seen has not been made out of things which are visible.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә dәrk edirik ki, kainat Allahın kәlamı ilә yarandı, belәcә dә görünәn şeylәr görünmәyәnlәrdәn törәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he had testimony given to him that he was righteous, God testifying with respect to his gifts; and through it he, being dead, still speaks.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә Habil Allaha Qabildәn daha yaxşı bir qurban tәqdim etdi. Bunun vasitәsilә saleh olduğu tәsdiq olundu, çünki Allah onun tәqdimlәri barәdә şәhadәt etdi. Habil ölmüş olduğu halda iman vasitәsilә hәlә dә danışır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Enoch was taken away, so that he wouldn’t see death, and he was not found, because God translated him. For he has had testimony given to him that before his translation he had been well pleasing to God.

block.text: Xanok ölümü görmәsin deyә iman vasitәsilә dünyadan götürüldü. Onu tapa bilmәdilәr, çünki Allah onu dünyadan götürmüşdü. Götürülmәzdәn әvvәl o, şәhadәt almışdı ki, Allahı razı salıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him. He who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

block.text: İman olmadan Allahı razı salmaq qeyri-mümkündür. Çünki Allaha yaxınlaşan şәxs inanmalıdır ki, O var vә Onu axtaranlara mükafat verir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Noah, being warned about things not yet seen, moved with godly fear. He prepared a ship for the saving of his house, through which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.

block.text: Nuh hәlә gözә görünmәyәn şeylәr barәsindә edilәn xәbәrdarlığa iman vasitәsilә ciddi yanaşaraq öz ev әhlinin xilası üçün gәmi düzәltdi. O, iman vasitәsilә dünyanı mәhkum etdi vә imana görә olan salehliyi irs olaraq aldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out to the place which he was to receive for an inheritance. He went out, not knowing where he went.

block.text: İbrahim çağırılanda iman vasitәsilә itaәtli olub irs alacağı torpağa getdi. O hara getdiyini bilmәyәrәk yola çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, he lived as an alien in the land of promise, as in a land not his own, dwelling in tents, with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә vәd edilmiş ölkәdә bir qәrib kimi mәskunlaşdı. O eyni vәdin hәmvarislәri olan İshaq vә Yaqubla birlikdә çadırlarda yaşadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he looked for the city which has the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

block.text: Çünki İbrahim memarı vә banisi Allah olan bünövrәli şәhәri gözlәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, even Sarah herself received power to conceive, and she bore a child when she was past age, since she counted him faithful who had promised.

block.text: Sara özü sonsuz vә yaşı ötmüş olduğu halda iman vasitәsilә nәsil yaratmaq üçün güc aldı, çünki vәd Edәni sadiq saydı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore as many as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as innumerable as the sand which is by the sea shore, were fathered by one man, and him as good as dead.

block.text: Buna görә dә bir kişidәn, artıq ölüdәn fәrqlәnmәyәn birindәn sayca göydәki ulduzlar qәdәr, dәniz kәnarındakı qum kimi saysız-hesabsız nәsil törәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them and embraced them from afar. They confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.

block.text: Bunların hamısı imanlı olaraq öldü. Vәd edilәn şeylәrә nail olmadılar, amma bunları uzaqdan görüb salamladılar vә özlәrinin yer üzündә yad vә qәrib olduqlarını iqrar etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For those who say such things make it clear that they are seeking a country of their own.

block.text: Axı belә sözlәri deyәnlәr bir vәtәn axtardıqlarını göstәrirlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If indeed they had been thinking of that country from which they went out, they would have had enough time to return.

block.text: Әgәr onlar çıxdıqları ölkә barәsindә düşünsәydilәr, qayıtmağa imkanları olardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.

block.text: Amma әslindә onlar daha yaxşı bir ölkәni, yәni sәmavi vәtәni arzu edirdilәr. Buna görә Allah Özünü onların Allahı adlandırmaqdan utanmır, çünki O onlar üçün şәhәr hazırlamışdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Abraham, being tested, offered up Isaac. Yes, he who had gladly received the promises was offering up his one and only son;

block.text: İbrahim sınağa çәkildiyi vaxt iman vasitәsilә İshaqı qurban olaraq tәqdim etdi. Vәdlәrә nail olmuş İbrahim bircә oğlunu qurban vermәk niyyәtindә idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: even he to whom it was said,

block.text: Halbuki ona deyilmişdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In Isaac will your seed be called”

block.text: <<İshaqdan törәyәnlәr sәnin nәslin adlanacaq>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: concluding that God is able to raise up even from the dead. Figuratively speaking, he also did receive him back from the dead.

block.text: O, Allahı onu ölülәr arasından diriltmәyә qadir saydı. Buna görә dә mәcazi mәnada İshaqı ölümdәn geri aldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau, even concerning things to come.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә İshaq gәlәcәk hadisәlәrlә әlaqәdar Yaquba vә Esava xeyir-dua verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff.

block.text: Yaqub ölәrkәn Yusifin hәr iki oğluna iman vasitәsilә xeyir-dua verdi vә öz dәyәnәyinin başına söykәnib Allaha sәcdә etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Joseph, when his end was near, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel; and gave instructions concerning his bones.

block.text: Yusif dә ölәrkәn İsrail övladlarının Misirdәn çıxacaqları haqqında iman vasitәsilә söz söylәyәrәk öz sümüklәri barәsindә әmr verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Moses, when he was born, was hidden for three months by his parents. They saw that he was a beautiful child, and they were not afraid of the king’s commandment.

block.text: Musa doğulanda anası vә atası iman vasitәsilә onu üç ay gizlәtdilәr. Çünki onlar uşağın gözәl olduğunu görüb padşahın fәrmanından qorxmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter.

block.text: Musa böyüyәndәn sonra firon qızının oğlu adlanmaqdan iman vasitәsilә imtina etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He choose rather to share ill treatment with God’s people, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a time;

block.text: Günahdan müvәqqәti zövq almaqdansa Allahın xalqı ilә birlikdә әzab çәkmәyi üstün tutdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: accounting the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt; for he looked to the reward.

block.text: Mәsih naminә çәkdiyi tәhqiri Misir xәzinәlәrindәn daha böyük var-dövlәt saydı, çünki alacağı mükafata gözünü dikmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, he left Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә padşahın qәzәbindәn qorxmayıb Misirdәn çıxdı, çünki o, gözә Görünmәyәni sanki görmüş kimi möhkәm dayandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, he kept the Passover, and the sprinkling of the blood, that the destroyer of the firstborn should not touch them.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә Musa Pasxa qurbanının kәsilmәsini vә onun qanının çilәnmәsini hәyata keçirtdi ki, ilk doğulanları öldürәn mәhvedici mәlәk İsraillilәrә toxunmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, they passed through the Red Sea as on dry land. When the Egyptians tried to do so, they were swallowed up.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә İsraillilәr Qırmızı dәnizi qurudan keçәn kimi keçdilәr. Misirlilәr dә bunu etmәyә cәhd etdilәr, amma boğuldular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been encircled for seven days.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә İsraillilәr yeddi gün Yerixonun әtrafında gәzdikdәn sonra onun divarları yıxıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith, Rahab the prostitute, didn’t perish with those who were disobedient, having received the spies in peace.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә fahişә Raxav casusları dostcasına qarşıladığı üçün itaәtli olmayanlarla birgә hәlak olmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What more shall I say? For the time would fail me if I told of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets.

block.text: Daha nә deyә bilәrәm? Gideon, Baraq, Şimşon, İftah, Davud, Şamuel vә başqa peyğәmbәrlәr barәsindә danışsam, vaxtım çatmaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These people through faith subdued kingdoms, worked out righteousness, obtained promises, and stopped the mouths of lions.

block.text: İman vasitәsilә onlar padşahlıqları mәğlub etdilәr, әdalәti icra etdilәr, vәdlәrә nail oldular, aslanların ağızlarını bağladılar,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness they were made strong. They grew mighty in war and caused foreign armies to flee.

block.text: şiddәtli alovu söndürdülәr, qılıncın ağzından qaçdılar, zәiflikdәn qüvvәtlәndilәr, döyüşdә güclü oldular, yadellilәrin ordularını qovdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Women received their dead by resurrection. Others were tortured, not accepting their deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection.

block.text: Qadınlar öz ölülәrini dirilmiş geri aldılar. Bәzilәri işgәncә çәkәndә qurtulmaqdan imtina etdilәr ki, dirilib daha yaxşı hәyata nail olsunlar;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others were tried by mocking and scourging, yes, moreover by bonds and imprisonment.

block.text: digәrlәri dә tәhqir olunub döyüldülәr, habelә zәncirlәrә vә hәbslәrә mәruz qaldılar;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, and ill-treated.

block.text: onlar daşqalaq edildilәr, mişarlanıb bölündülәr, qılıncdan keçirilib öldürüldülәr. Bәzilәri isә qoyun dәrisinә vә keçi gönünә bürünәrәk gәzib-dolaşdılar, yoxsulluğa, әzab-әziyyәtә mәruz qaldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (The world was not worthy of them.) They wandered in deserts, mountains, caves, and the holes of the earth.

block.text: Dünya onlara layiq deyildi. Onlar sәhralarda, dağlarda, mağaralarda vә yeraltı oyuqlarda dolaşıb gәzdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These all, having had testimony given to them through their faith, didn’t receive the promise.

block.text: Onların hamısı iman vasitәsilә müsbәt şәhadәt aldı, amma vәd edilәnә nail olmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God had planned something better for us so that only together with us would they be made perfect.

block.text: Çünki Allah bizim üçün daha yaxşı şey hazırlamışdır ki, onlar bizsiz kamilliyә çatmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 12

Therefore let us also, seeing we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, lay aside every weight and the sin which so easily entangles us. Let us run with patience the race that is set before us.

block.text: Buna görә bu qәdәr böyük şahidlәr buludu ilә әhatә olunduğumuz üçün biz hәr bir yükü vә bizi asanlıqla çaşdıran günahı tәrk edib qarşımızdakı yarışda dözümlә qaçaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let us look to Jesus, the author and perfecter of faith. Who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising its shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

block.text: Gözümüzü imanımızın Banisi vә Kamillәşdiricisi olan İsaya dikәk. O, qarşısına qoyulan sevincә görә rüsvayçılığı heç sayıb çarmıxa çәkilmәyә tab gәtirdi vә Allahın taxtının sağında oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For consider him who has endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, that you don’t grow weary, fainting in your souls.

block.text: Günahkarlardan Ona qarşı olan bu qәdәr düşmәnçiliyә dözәn Şәxs barәsindә düşünün ki, yorulub ruhdan düşmәyәsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood.

block.text: Günaha qarşı etdiyiniz mübarizәdә hәlә qan tökülәcәk qәdәr möhkәm durmamısınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have forgotten that word of encouragement that addresses you as sons,

block.text: Sizә oğul deyib verilәn bu nәsihәti unutdunuz:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My son, don’t take lightly the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when you are reproved by him;

block.text: <<Oğlum, Rәbbin verdiyi tәrbiyәyә xor baxma, Onun mәzәmmәtindәn ruhdan düşmә.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whom the Lord loves, he chastens, and scourges every son whom he receives.”

block.text: Çünki Rәbb sevdiyini tәrbiyәlәndirәr, Qәbul etdiyi hәr oğulu döyәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is for discipline that you endure. God deals with you as with children, for what son is there whom his father doesn’t discipline?

block.text: Tәrbiyәyә tab gәtirin. Allah sizinlә övladları kimi rәftar edir. Elә bir oğul varmı atası onu tәrbiyәlәndirmәsin?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you are without discipline, of which all have been made partakers, then are you illegitimate, and not children.

block.text: Hәr kәs üçün ümumi olan tәrbiyәdәn mәhrum olsanız, demәli, siz oğul yox, qeyri-qanuni övladsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to chasten us, and we paid them respect. Shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits, and live?

block.text: Hәm dә әgәr bizi tәrbiyәlәndirәn cismani atalarımıza hörmәt ediriksә, ruhani Ataya daha çox tabe olaraq yaşamalı deyilikmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they indeed, for a few days, punished us as seemed good to them; but he for our profit, that we may be partakers of his holiness.

block.text: Atalarımız bizi qısa bir müddәtә öz dәrk etdiklәri kimi tәrbiyәlәndirdilәr. Amma Allah Onun müqәddәsliyinә ortaq olaq deyә bizi xeyrimiz üçün tәrbiyәlәndirir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All chastening seems for the present to be not joyous but grievous; yet afterward it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been exercised thereby.

block.text: Hәr tәrbiyә isә indiki vaxt sevinc deyil, kәdәr verәn bir şey kimi görünür, amma sonradan bu yolda yetişdirilәnlәrә salehliyin dinclik sәmәrәsini hasil edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore lift up the hands that hang down and the feeble knees.

block.text: Buna görә yorğun әllәrinizi qaldırın vә zәiflәnmiş dizlәrinizi güclәndirin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Make straight paths for your feet, so that that which is lame may not be dislocated, but rather be healed.

block.text: Ayaqlarınız üçün düz yollar seçin ki, axsaq bәdәn üzvlәriniz yerindәn çıxmasın, әksinә sağalsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Follow after peace with all men, and the sanctification without which no man will see the Lord.

block.text: Hamı ilә birlikdә sülh içindә yaşamağa vә müqәddәs olmağa can atın, çünki müqәddәsliyә nail olmadan heç kim Rәbbi görmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Look carefully lest there be any man who falls short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and many be defiled by it.

block.text: Diqqәt edin ki, heç kim Allahın lütfündәn mәhrum olmasın, aranızda bir acı kök böyüyüb әziyyәt vermәsin vә bununla bir çoxlarını murdar etmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: See that no one is sexually immoral, or is godless like Esau, who sold his birthright for one meal.

block.text: Qoy heç kim әxlaqsız vә yaxud Esav kimi allahsız olmasın. O, bir qab xörәyә görә öz ilk oğulluq haqqını satdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you know that even when he afterward desired to inherit the blessing, he was rejected. He found no place for a change of mind though he sought it diligently with tears.

block.text: Bilirsiniz ki, bundan sonra da o, xeyir-duanı irs olaraq almaq istәyirdi, lakin rәdd olundu. Xeyir-duanı göz yaşları ilә axtardısa da, atasının fikrini dәyişmәyә qadir olmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You did not come to a mountain that you could touch: there was no bonfire, no darkness, no night, no storm.

block.text: Siz toxunula bilәn, odla yanan bir şeyә, qaranlığa, zülmәtә, qasırğaya,

ReferenceBlocks.text: You did not hear the sound of the trumpet or the sound of words. The Israelites who heard this noise refused to listen to another word.

block.text: şeypur gurultusuna vә kәlam söylәyәn sәsә yaxınlaşmadınız; o sәsi eşidәnlәr onlara daha bir söz deyilmәsin deyә yalvardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They could not withstand this order:

block.text: Çünki әmrinә tab gәtirә bilmәzdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If even an animal touches the mountain, it shall be stoned,”

block.text: <<әgәr dağa bir heyvan belә, toxunsa, o, daşqalaq edilsin>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and so fearful was the appearance, that Moses said,

block.text: Bu mәnzәrә o qәdәr qorxunc idi ki, Musa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am terrified and trembling.”

block.text: <<mәn qorxu vә lәrzә içindәyәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you have come to Mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to innumerable multitudes of angels,

block.text: Lakin siz Sion dağına, var olan Allahın şәhәrinә – sәmavi Yerusәlimә, saysız-hesabsız mәlәklәrә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: to the general assembly and assembly of the firstborn who are enrolled in heaven, to God the Judge of all, to the spirits of just men made perfect,

block.text: göylәrdә adları qeyd edilmiş ilk doğulanların ümumi mәclisinә vә cәmiyyәtinә, hamının Hakimi olan Allaha, kamala çatmış salehlәrin ruhlarına,

ReferenceBlocks.text: to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better than that of Abel.

block.text: Yeni Әhdin Vasitәçisi olan İsaya vә Habilin qanından daha üstün söz deyәn sәpilmiş qana yaxınlaşdınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: See that you don’t refuse him who speaks. For if they didn’t escape when they refused him who warned on the earth, how much more will we not escape who turn away from him who warns from heaven.

block.text: Bunu Deyәni rәdd etmәyәsiniz deyә diqqәtli olun. Çünki әgәr yer üzündә xәbәrdarlıq edәni rәdd edәnlәr cәzadan qaça bilmәdilәrsә, biz göylәrdәn xәbәrdarlıq Edәndәn üz döndәrsәk, cәzadan qaça bilmәyәcәyimiz daha çox yәqindir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His voice shook the earth then, but now he has promised, saying,

block.text: O vaxt Onun sәsi yeri sarsıtdı. Amma indi deyә vәd etmişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yet once more I will shake not only the earth, but also the heavens.”

block.text: <<Mәn bir dәfә dә yalnız yeri yox, göyü dә lәrzәyә gәtirәcәyәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: This phrase, “Yet once more,” signifies the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that have been made, that those things which are not shaken may remain.

block.text: <<Bir dәfә dә>>sözü bunu göstәrir: sarsıla bilәn, yәni yaradılmış şeylәr aradan qaldırılacaq ki, sarsıla bilmәyәnlәr daim var olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, receiving a Kingdom that can’t be shaken, let us have grace, through which we serve God acceptably, with reverence and awe,

block.text: Buna görә sarsılmaz Padşahlığa nail olduğumuz üçün minnәtdar olaq; belә ki möminlik vә ehtiramla Allaha mәqbul tәrzdә Ona ibadәt edәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for our God is a consuming fire.

block.text: Çünki Allahımız yandırıb-yaxan alovdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: HEBREWS 13
Let brotherly love continue.

block.text: Aranızda daimi qardaşlıq sevgisi olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t forget to show hospitality to strangers, for in doing so, some have entertained angels without knowing it.

block.text: Qonaqpәrvәr olmağı da unutmayın, çünki belә davranan bәzilәri bilmәdәn mәlәklәrә qonaqpәrvәrlik göstәrmişlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Remember those who are in bonds, as bound with them; and those who are ill-treated, since you are also in the body.

block.text: Özünüzü hәbsdә olanların yerinә qoyaraq onları yada salın. Әzab-әziyyәt içindә olanları da elә xatırlayın ki, sanki özünüz onlarla birgә әzab-әziyyәt çәkirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let marriage be held in honor among all, and let the bed be undefiled: but God will judge the sexually immoral and adulterers.

block.text: Qoy hәr kәs nikaha hörmәtlә yanaşsın. Qoy әr-arvad yatağı murdarlanmasın. Çünki Allah әxlaqsızları vә zinakarları mühakimә edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said,
